qas.question: How many miles is the city from Isaac's Tavern?
Why is Isaac Hunter's Tavern popular?
What was Raleigh as a city?

answers.text: the downtown streets of North, East, West and South streets

qas.question: What city was the plan based on?
Who does not go to Isaac Hunter's Tavern?

plausible_answers.text: North, East, West and South streets

qas.question: What city was the plan not inspired by?

plausible_answers.text: two main axes meeting at a central square

qas.question: What is the opposite of a grid system?

context: The city's location was chosen, in part, for being within <a0_0>11<a0_0/> mi (18 km) of Isaac Hunter's Tavern, a popular tavern frequented by the <a1_0><b5_0>state legislators<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> No known city or town existed previously on the chosen city site. Raleigh is one of the few cities in the United States that was <a2_0>planned<a2_0/> and built specifically to serve as a state capital. Its original boundaries were formed by <a3_0>the downtown streets of <b6_0>North, East, West and South streets<b6_0/><a3_0/>. The plan, a grid with <b9_0>two main axes meeting at a central square<b9_0/> and an additional square in each corner, was based on <b8_0>Thomas Holme's<b8_0/> 1682 plan for <a4_0><b7_0>Philadelphia<b7_0/><a4_0/>.
